CapGainsLossTxInvstIncmGrp.PropertyDesc: ALTERNATIVE INVESTMENTS REPORTED ON A K-1

SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description1Txt: ACCION OPPORTUNITY FUND THE ANNENBERG FOUNDATION COMMITTED $2.0 MILLION TO ACCION OPPORTUNITY FUND (AOF) IN 2019, FUNDING THE INVESTMENT IN Q12021. IN 2020, THE FORMER OPPORTUNITY FUND MERGED WITH ACCION U.S. NETWORK TO FORM AOF. AOF IS A CDFI THAT MAKES LOANS TO LOW-TO-MODERATE INCOME BORROWERS; 20% LATINO, 14% BLACK BORROWERS. NATIONWIDE, AOF REPORTS THAT 90% OF LOANS ARE TO LOW-INCOME BORROWERS OR BORROWERS OF COLOR.
SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description2Txt: ILLUMEN CAPITAL THE FOUNDATION COMMITTED $2.5 MILLION TO ILLUMEN CAPITAL IN 2020. ILLUMEN IS A PRIVATE EQUITY FIRM AND FUND OF FUNDS MANAGER THAT ADDRESSES SYSTEMIC INEQUITY BY INVESTING IN GENDER AND RACIALLY DIVERSE-LED FUNDS AND PROVIDING EVIDENCE-BASED RACIAL BIAS REDUCTION TRAINING TO UNLOCK RETURNS AND IMPACT. APPROXIMATELY 25% OF PORTFOLIO COMPANIES ARE OWNED BY RACIALLY DIVERSE LEADERS AND 34% ARE OWNED BY WOMEN.

RlnOfActyToAccomOfExmptPrpsGrp.RelationshipStatementTxt: ANNENBERG LEARNER, A UNIT OF THE ANNENBERG FOUNDATION, ADVANCES EXCELLENT TEACHING IN AMERICAN SCHOOLS BY DISTRIBUTING MULTIMEDIA EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES FOR TEACHERS AND STUDENTS AND BY COMMUNICATING BEST TEACHING PRACTICES TO EDUCATORS, ADMINISTRATORS, AND THE PUBLIC THROUGH OUTREACH AND PARTNERSHIPS. THESE RESOURCES AND OUTREACH PROVIDE CURRENT RESEARCH ON LEARNING AND CONTENT UPDATES ACROSS MANY DISCIPLINES. ANNENBERG LEARNER CONTRACTS WITH AWARD-WINNING MULTIMEDIA PRODUCERS WHO WORK WITH ACADEMIC AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT EXPERTS IN EACH DISCIPLINE TO CREATE THE VIDEOS, PRINT, AND WEB RESOURCES. ANNENBERG LEARNER DISTRIBUTES THESE RESOURCES DIGITALLY AT A COST TO COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES WISHING TO LICENSE THE PROGRAMS, AND PROVIDES FREE ACCESS TO DIGITAL FORMATS THROUGH ITS WEBSITE TO K-12 EDUCATORS, STUDENTS, AND LIFE-LONG LEARNERS: WWW.LEARNER.ORG.

AllOtherProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Desc: SDS SUPPORTIVE HOUSING FUND, LP The Supportive Housing Fund seeks to finance 1,800 units of permanent supportive housing over the next six years with a focus on homelessness in Los Angeles County.
